channel.title: Comments on: My Journey with Meteor as a Teacher-Coder
channel.description: iteration, making, building, and coding in education

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2016/03/11/my-journey-with-meteor-as-a-teacher-coder/#comment-442">Brian Bennett</a>.
From the comments I've been receiving from various channels, there's a need for understanding the steps. Stay tuned.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Brian Bennett.

From the comments I’ve been receiving from various channels, there’s a need for understanding the steps. Stay tuned.

item.title: By: Brian Bennett
item.dc:creator: Brian Bennett
item.description:
This post has convinced me to spend some time learning Meteor. I can see a bunch of applications for physics and chemistry...I just need to find time to do it now.
Any chance you would write up how you deploy the apps to your own server? I'd be in the same boat.
item.content:encoded:
This post has convinced me to spend some time learning Meteor. I can see a bunch of applications for physics and chemistry…I just need to find time to do it now.

Any chance you would write up how you deploy the apps to your own server? I’d be in the same boat.
